abstract: Instead of receiving a warm embrace, American policies were rebuked again and again in rhetoric that recalled the anger of the Bush years — mainly aimed at what the world views as the new threat of protectionism by the United States.
snippet: Instead of receiving a warm embrace, American policies were rebuked again and again in rhetoric that recalled the anger of the Bush years — mainly aimed at what the world views as the new threat of protectionism by the United States.
lead_paragraph: This was supposed to be the year the United States came in from the cold at the annual gathering of world leaders in Davos, Switzerland. But instead of receiving a warm embrace, American policies were rebuked again and again in rhetoric that recalled the anger of the Bush years — mainly aimed at what the world views as the new threat of protectionism by the United States, The New York Times’s Nelson D. Schwartz writes.

headline.main: World Leaders Wary of U.S. Economic Measures

abstract: A group of disgruntled Bank of America shareholders plans to demand the ouster of the bank’s chairman and chief executive, Kenneth D. Lewis, at the firm’s upcoming annual meeting, The New York Post reported.
lead_paragraph: A group of disgruntled Bank of America shareholders plans to demand the ouster of the bank’s chairman and chief executive, Kenneth D. Lewis, at the firm’s upcoming annual meeting, The New York Post reported.

headline.main: Unhappy BofA Shareholders to Seek Changes, Report Says
